intro: Diasperus concolor, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its stems are often prostrate or ascending, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Diasperus concolor is an important plant in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various desert wildlife.
